website_summaries.verdict: On a budget but want an effective WiFi extender? This is worth a look. The addition of an Ethernet port for directly attaching wired devices such as video game consoles is a plus.
pros: Great price, especially for what you get
surprisingly adept at eliminating dead spots and boosting range
cons: Easy to set up, but instructions are not much help if you do run into trouble

customer_reviews.title: Very reliable - great product
customer_reviews.text: I've had these extenders before in my house which didn't work, my house has all solid walls. I got this one which gives a 2Ghz and 5Ghz signal with my newly installed BT Broadband home hub, thus far it has worked perfectly and I've had it around a month. I am running 2 Sky Q boxes in my bedrooms and 2 phones from it and we always get a strong signal and high-speed downloads. Highly recommended, wasn't crazy expensive either.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth McLeod

customer_reviews.title: Not worth buying
customer_reviews.text: EDIT: After using this repeater for several weeks it saddens me to say I returned it as the signal dropped every few minutes making it impossible to use. I’m in a black spot and WiFi’s awful, previously bought 2 repeaters but not good, this little fella was easy to set up and boy I can get full strength in my conservatory whereas before I got nothing with other repeaters I’d say if you want a descent affordable repeater then grab the mini it’s well worth it. X
customer_reviews.author: Hazel Skelton

customer_reviews.title: Waste of time
customer_reviews.text: I am not completely IT illiterate but cannot get this Extender to work properly. Trying to connect via the web interface leads to multiple disconnects during the set up process. I gave up after the 10th attempt as life is too short. I then connected via WPS (which I don't usually do as I like to understand where the process stands) and whilst it has connected to my main router there is no internet pass through, the connection to my laptop keeps disconnecting and the extender interface page has become unreachable. This is a complete waste of time and effort. I have returned for a full refund using Amazon's usual excellent service, but avoid this product!
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Waste of time.
customer_reviews.text: Not able to connect via WPS as my other extenders have done, and when attempting to connect through a browser there was nothing found. Tried ringing Netgear support several times, but after a few rings the line repeatedly cut off. Will go with another brand. What a waste of time!
customer_reviews.author: Webshopper77

customer_reviews.title: Useless
customer_reviews.text: This thing for me was totally not worth it, somehow this thing gave off a worse signal and slower speed than my Sky hub does. No matter where I placed it, any device I connected to it was actually worse off than just connecting to my hub. This for me was a waste of money and is now just dumped in the cupboard.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. S

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BOTHER - doesn't even cover the room NEXT DOOR to where the extender is placed - total waste of money.
customer_reviews.text: DONT BOTHER - this extender has SUCH POOR reception. If you just walk outside of the room where the extender is the reception is so poor it refuses to pick up the Extender. Never mind 50 meters, that's a joke! I can pick up 1 bar of my own wifi at the back of the garden - I can pick up ZERO bar of the wifi extender in the hallway - about 2 meters from where the extender is. It does NOT WORK - total waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: An Dutton

customer_reviews.title: Can't Fault
customer_reviews.text: Works great, easy to set up can't fault; however for the normal domestic set up you will probably find the more basic model is all you need.
customer_reviews.author: Aitch

customer_reviews.title: Reliable, easy to set up booster for your wireless network
customer_reviews.text: Simple to install. The most important thing to note is that it generates a secondary hot spot for you devices to connect to that need it. Using the WPS function to link it to your main router will save hours of heartache logging into set up pages and the like. In summary. Easy set up. Good 'range' and having had this for some time now it has proved faultless in operation. Will even reconnect if you have to re-power your router for any reason.
customer_reviews.author: Redders

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work for me
customer_reviews.text: I have tried the setup through the instructions provided in the booklet. Didn't work: the device was connected, the signal showed good strength but a message 'internet may not be availble' appeared and there was no internet via the extender. The manufacturer sent instructions which is basically the same as booklet supplied in the packaging, I followed it but the instructions only applied to ...listed devices and my model was not on the list. I tried the link for Mac OS on that website but the link did not open - 'the site can't be reached'. Very disappointed as I bought it based on the reviews. Unfortunately, will be returning the product.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Holt

customer_reviews.title: Coverage may not be what they say
customer_reviews.text: I've been trying to get a wifi signal to my garage so that I can install a Nest IQ Camera. It's not that far but through a couple of walls, one of which is a 250 year old cottage wall. I first tried an EX2700/N300 and then an EX6410/AC1900 neither extended WIFI as far as I wanted. I then tried cascading two EX6410/AC1900s, this worked for a few hours and would then need rebooting, the wifi signal was reasonably strong but too weak at times for the cloud streaming to the Nest server. Subsequently, I bit the bullet and bought a Nighthawk X6S AC3000 which is a totally different kettle of fish and has cured my problem!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: not worth it
customer_reviews.text: set was easy but it kept disconnecting for no logical reason. I only had it set up for one day and during that time it disconnected at least twice from the internet. The was no logical reason for it to do this and I'm not trouble shooting a item that should be plug and play with the WPS button. I quickly returned it for a full refund and just ended up moving my router to cover the whole house.
customer_reviews.author: Leet8845

customer_reviews.title: Great solution to improve the WiFi strength in your house
customer_reviews.text: Like a lot of people at the moment I'm working from home. I wasn't getting decent WiFi strength at the back of the house and this was causing my laptop to disconnect from my works network. This has solved the problem. It was really easy to pair with my Netgear D6400 router. Following the instructions I pressed the WPS buttons on the extender and router to connect the 2.4 GHz network then the 5 GHz. I then plugged the extender where I need it. If you're having problems with your WiFi and think it's down to a poor signal the further away you get from the router, give one of these a go.
customer_reviews.author: Gareth Peters

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly
customer_reviews.text: Before buying anything online I always read the reviews, this one seemed to have quite a few negative reviews so was apprehensive buying it. I was looking at Netgear as I know commercial businesses use them to extend their wifi throughout their offices, I have seen and worked with Netgrear equipment before and never had an issue but this was expensive business products.. I did order it and absolutely can not fault it. It was very quick and easy to set up and the wifi now reaches all areas of my house. My very happy little girl is able to finally watch a whole programme on her Smart TV without the connection being lost.
customer_reviews.author: JRx

customer_reviews.title: Might not be the best solution for your problem
customer_reviews.text: I bought this before I read up properly on it. If you have dead spots around your house with poor or no WiFi signal don’t buy these. They’re designed to connect to your existing router wirelessly so won’t help you at all, by the time this things pumps out the WiFi signal the speeds and quality getting to your devices are not terrible. I’d use a power line adaptor to feed this or use a Mesh system like TP Link Deco M4. That said this thing is actually well built, easy to install and setup.
customer_reviews.author: Rian Stuart

customer_reviews.title: 5 GHz not working (anymore)
customer_reviews.text: After few days with no reason it doesn't work on 5 GHz (was working pretty well). It still works on 2,4 GHz but it's much slower. On 5 GHz THERE IS A CONNECTION with yellow triangle on Wi-Fi icon (Windows 10) with information "No internet, secured" After trying all possible causes like location, security modes, channels changing, factory reset NOTHING WORKED and now it's useless as on 2,4 GHz I have same quality connection as with the original router. It is common problem and NETGEAR does not seem to be concerned about that so until they'll reply I strongly recommend NOT TO BUY this device.
customer_reviews.author: Norbert R.

customer_reviews.title: Overheats and Unsafe.
customer_reviews.text: The first one I received was overheating drastically to a point where it was unsafe to leave unattended. After contacting customer support I was advised that this was not normal and that the product was to be returned for a replacement. The replacement was overheating in the same way. I assume that the product has somehow made it to the market without safety tests. I’ve seen other reviewers with the same issue. - It works fine. But at what price? You cannot leave it unattended.
customer_reviews.author: Sass

customer_reviews.title: Extremely difficult to configure !!
customer_reviews.text: The website recommended to configure this mywifiext.net doesn't work. Then when you follow the complicated instructions, you need to change your PC settings. Overall extremely complicated and instructions provided with this item are completely useless. Hence I am returning this item.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Skidmore

customer_reviews.title: Does not do what it claims!
customer_reviews.text: When I plug it in in the same room as the router it has a strong signal but move it 10 meters (to an adjacent room downstairs in house) and the red light comes on and it has a very weak signal - no better wifi signal, if not worse than without it. So no good - returned for refund unfortunately. Do any of these wifi extenders actually work as they claim they do? This is the second different brand of extender to fail to impress/help
customer_reviews.author: P. T. Moss

customer_reviews.title: Just a Range extender!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to improve the WiFi for my Ring doorbell which gets a poor signal when the weather is wet and windy. Set this up to use which was relatively easy but did not realise that it has its own unique SSID which meant that I would have to remove the Ring doorbell to connect it to the range extender. After several attempts I gave up and have returned the range extender. I have an old T-P Link range extender which actually works but is slow and this Netgear one, although newer and 'faster' (!) was much much worse. So back to the old T-P Link range extender.
customer_reviews.author: J Sedman

customer_reviews.title: Couldn't connect to router or device in the next room
customer_reviews.text: It was easy enough to set up and I had high hopes after reading the spec and positive reviews, but unfortunately it was worse than the wifi extender I had bought it to replace. It couldn't sustain a connection to the router in the next room for more than a few seconds before the green light turned red or went off completely. My computer was also in a room next to it (on the other side) as well and it could only pick that up if I moved it into the same room, so I had to return it to Amazon for a refund. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Snitzy-bitz

customer_reviews.title: Poor performance, returned
customer_reviews.text: You would think that going with a mainstream brand such as Netgear, the experience would be seamless. The performance of the product is awful, it's worse at picking up an existing network than existing devices, limiting the extension range. The speed at which is issues an IP address is awful (if it actually manages to). You can drop off the current network and be sat waiting to connect to the extended network, awful. On top of that sometimes it just fails to connect to the extended network. Item returned, would not recommend at all, I will try a different brand, probably TP Link.
customer_reviews.author: Darryl

customer_reviews.title: Would not connect to devices
customer_reviews.text: The router linked it's self to our existing wi/fi system with the press of a button on the side of the booster and main router. That was easy. Nightmare after that. It is meant to use the same password then as the main router. It did not and had no idea how to log into the booster. The App will not work as without the appropriate password you cannot log into it to make adjustments. I have seen reviews by people with better technical skills than me on how to hack into the booster to get the password, but that was beyond my technical skills. A positive, Amazon's return system works a treat.
customer_reviews.author: M. Stokes

customer_reviews.title: Great unit, but take care over instructions manual - refer to Timotei June 2017 instructions
customer_reviews.text: With thanks to Timotei, who did a review June 2017, and whose simple instructions got this kit working for me in minutes, where I had tried with the manual for an hour and failed!! I struggled with the unit when I unpacked it and tried to get it paired with my Wi-fi hub I used the manual, gave up, too complicated for me as I’m useless at tech, and packed it away. Then I tried a second time after reading Timotei instructions, gave it a go, it worked straight away, and has been perfect since! So, five stars, great unit, does the job. A good buy.
customer_reviews.author: SJI

customer_reviews.title: Performance really poor
customer_reviews.text: Not recommended. Speed when used through the extender dropped massive. The area with good coverage without extender i’m getting107mbps but when using extender at the same location speed dropped to 20mbps . So, just imagine when i moved the extender to my black spot area what the speed going to be. I’m getting only 2 to 3mbps for a 100mbps virginmedia connection at the black spot area in my bedroom.
customer_reviews.author: Anoop

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for hard to reach WIFI locations
customer_reviews.text: Brilliant little WIFI extender. Now I have WIFI in the 2nd and 3rd bedrooms where it was impossible to connect before. Fantastic! Really happy and have even created an office that connects to the Ethernet port running my Wyse terminal and phone via WiFi. Follow the instructions carefully as at first it didn’t work on the landing when trying different ‘spots’, but works fine at the furthest point of the house. I have a relatively new house (less than 20yrs), so walls are thin. Don’t therefore know what it would be like in larger, solid constructed houses.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing wall penetration
customer_reviews.text: Returned as unfit for purpose. I've trid extending my WiFi to another premesis which is behind 2 walls and approx 15 metres from router. 1. Placed the router at end of first property bringing the range to about 8 and 2 walls, couldnt pick it up with phone. 2. Placed it on closest wall in 2nd property and the router signal was very weak to the extender so the phone was receiving about 2mbps out of 90 total. May work for checking emails and basic web browsing but was hoping for at least 10mbps. Will probably need a more powerful model.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew's Review Corner

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly
customer_reviews.text: Got this to extend the range of my wi-fi to reach a wi-fi enabled birdbox camera right down the end of my garden - 30ft away. Now I can view the birds remotely when away from home. It works great! And now I've good wi-fi range out in my garden too. Perfect...and what it has done is also improved my actual wifi in the house too which was an added bonus. I find my phone opts for this connection over my actual main broadband connection, as it appears give off a better signal......which is weird. Very easy to set up and a well worth addition to any house. Solves alot of connection issues.
customer_reviews.author: CarMul

customer_reviews.title: boosts signal distance BUT delivers 10% of the mbps
customer_reviews.text: Ive recently swapped to virgin broadband and have a virgin hub 3.0, as an aside I would highly recommend AGAISNT virgin at the moment. I have around 100-120mbps when on the same soom as the router, which was great! However the WiFi signal is so poor, it loses any semblance of signal strength one room over, so much so most of the household has resorted to using their data when not directly next to the router. I purchased this booster that has said it goes up to 300mbps, I connected it up less than 1 metre from the router and we were getting 15mbps. I took it upstairs and I got 10mpbs. So all I'm all useless, try something else!
customer_reviews.author: Ebi

customer_reviews.title: An repeater more than an extender!!
customer_reviews.text: So i wanted to get WiFi in the garage and garden and bought this but not the right thing Really i needed to get a powerline adapter which i found really useful. THis takes the signal and as long as you place it close enough to the router it wil replicate and send it throught the house. Our issue was that we did not have a good signal in the beginning so were struggling to repeat :(
customer_reviews.author: Keith

customer_reviews.title: One of the best routers!
customer_reviews.text: My house has a couple of Wifi blind spots and I used one of the 300 Mbps Netgear extender earlier for one of the wifi blind spots with mixed results. I am using EX6120 for more than a week now and very happy with the range and the speed (almost similar to what I would get on direct Wifi connection to the router). Moreover, this extender can extend both the 2.4GHz and 5GHz bands showing up as two different networks. Note that 5GHz Wifi connection option would only be shown by a supported device. I used the internet based setup(not WPS) and it was a breeze. Provided instructions are very easy to follow. Also, the device is surprisingly small.
customer_reviews.author: keepintouch_2_9

customer_reviews.title: CCTV on my iPad at last.
customer_reviews.text: My CCTV on my iPad at last. I have my camera box upstairs in a room with not internet and after a friend said this WiFi extender should work. For £20 I gave it a go and boom my CCTV cameras on my phone and iPad at long last. I downloaded the app for my box scanned the qr code underneath the box, I plugged the Ethernet cable I to this and the box and that’s it I can now see my cameras with out going upstairs and looking at the monitor. My daughter has linked to it when in her room and she gets 100% better WiFi now she said. What a great buy this was. I love it.
customer_reviews.author: AudiDoodi

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't last long before playing up!
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for about 3 weeks then suddenly stopped. Connections to router and device both indicate green and remain stable, but speed has dropped below 1mb for a 40mb broadband. Tried resetting both router and extender several times. Gone on to check the firmware of the extender but the check function just spins and never returns a result. I moved the extender to the same room, as the router, nothing in the way, and still poor. It's not just the WiFi, if I plug an ethernet cable into the extender it's the same. Going to go for mesh wifi system, may cost more but better than this!
customer_reviews.author: S

customer_reviews.title: not great, not bad
customer_reviews.text: very easy to use, but I'm not finding it extends the range as much as advertised. Granted I'm in a brick house, not a plasterboard Palace, so the solid internal walls aren't helping, but that said, the positioning was spot on initially, now it seems to have dipped in signal strength. Also finding it is dropping off for no apparent reason and I'm having to reconnect (it appears in the WiFi list but just disconnects itself), which is obviously a pain when streaming TV shows or films. So basically, when it works its fine, but after a couple of months it kicks you for whatever reason.
customer_reviews.author: scott

customer_reviews.title: Really good signal with plug
customer_reviews.text: Really pleased with signal boost. I can now write this review from my phone in room wifi was weak. TV now working picking up wifi signal. I am ok at tech, but found being offered a choice of set up instructions confusing and had to factory reset after trying the 1st instructions which left my wifi without password protection. The second set of instructions worked. I had to set up a new password for an account, but then could keep the wifi password for plug boost. Means my device can switch between the wifi and plug extension for best signal. Worth the effort of setting up to get a consistently strong signal
customer_reviews.author: sapitt

customer_reviews.title: It didn't actually extend my network's range
customer_reviews.text: After going through the convoluted set-up interface, which *requires* you to register an account with Netgear to use it, I was disappointed to find that I wasn't getting better WiFi coverage than before. Sure, the new (extended) network was up, but it was even slower than the original one with low signal. This extender also seems very unreliable with 5 GHz networks. Although it initially worked for an hour or so, it then refused to connect any more until a hard reboot. Online forums suggest that this is a known problem with the device's firmware, which was never addressed. This product didn't do it's job for me, so I can't recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Carl

customer_reviews.title: Intermittently effective
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointing. Set up was ok but limited instructions in the box. Initially worked ok but firstly annoying that it doesn’t just extend your existing Wi-fi, the extended signal is different to your base signal. Secondly, it has become very intermittent. The box heats up if left on so perhaps that is why we regularly have to re-boot it. Finally, to check the system you need to log on to its signal, so not helpful if not working.
customer_reviews.author: NB

customer_reviews.title: Works fine, but creates a separate connection spot
customer_reviews.text: Fairly easy to set up and now that it is set up, it does the job with no issues. The only problem is that it effectively sets up a second Wi-Fi point to connect to, rather than being a pure clone of the original. This can lead to situations where your device can faintly see your router and so stays connected to it, even when it would be better off switching across to the Netgear Wi-Fi signal. For us, this hasn't been any issue as our router is at one end of the house, so we put the extender right in the middle and connect everything to that. But it could be an issue for others.
customer_reviews.author: S. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Did not work. My router gave me better speed than this.
customer_reviews.text: I have ordered this device to give a better internet speed to my ring cam outdoor. I have followed the instructions and connected using easily to my Virgin Hub 3 and I have placed it just behind my ring camera (obviously inside). But it did not help. I have done some speed test and in my case the Virgin router gave me better speed than the Netgear. I have tried all of the rooms in my home and every time the router was better. So I have just sent it back. I do not know how does it work in other homes or maybe I got a faulty one, but considering my case I can not recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Gabor Legar

customer_reviews.title: A faulty product I think but tech support was bad.
customer_reviews.text: The Netgear Wifi Ranger Extender arrived in time, plugged it in but I was unable to access the software on board, I tried technical support who wanted access to my camera plus other files not related to the network so I refused then I lost all access to my wireless router options and that needed a restart which also failed, in the end, I found that the only way to fix the issue was to unplug the extender which restored my connections its a shame as it could have helped extend my service but I will try something else at a later date.
customer_reviews.author: F. Tennant

customer_reviews.title: Buy this!!! Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Cost effective way to extend our poor signal upstairs in a three bed house. We installed super fast cable broadband believing it would solve the issue of buffering upstairs but it didn’t work. New supplier said they could supply their extender at £3pm. We did our research and got this fabulous extender thereby saving money.simple to install once you’ve picked it up as your WiFi connection on devices you are using upstairs and simple enough to switch back to main house broadband when back downstairs. However we only wanted this for TVs so they are permanently logged in and Netflix/Amazon/Iplayer and catch-up work effortlessly now.
customer_reviews.author: happyshopper

customer_reviews.title: Works really well
customer_reviews.text: Did exactly what I needed and massively boosted the Wifi signal to a room upstairs from the router downstairs. I was really surprised at how much stronger the signal was and it has made working from home much easier, with no drop-outs (so far - have had it for a week). It's only single band (2.4ghz) so just bear that in mind if you purchase, however, for my needs it was perfect (5ghz doesn't traverse floors/ceilings anyway, so not needed). Only downside was that the set up instructions were a little vague, but once its working, its great. Good value for money.
customer_reviews.author: The Fury Zone

customer_reviews.title: NetGear is best known for the network devices... and I am pleased
customer_reviews.text: Reviewing after 4 months as few devices like this can tell only after certain time! This has very good reach and I do not see any drop in the connection. I got for 18 pounds and that was a great stuff too. Some are selling for lot less but would question if you get it with good brands, it stands for some time. Few old systems do not support 5K frequency that with my new router and now I hooked all those to this Netgear with 2.5 Frequency and works amazing. Even though there are lots of wifi devices at my place, the connectivity is fab and no problems so far.
customer_reviews.author: Sai Marg

customer_reviews.title: Boosted signal.
customer_reviews.text: I have EE fibre broadband, the router being installed at the front of the house. I have a conservatory at the rear and have always struggled with wifi signals dropping out. If I make mobile calls then always had to go in proximity of the router. I have plugged this extender in a socket in the conservatory. Easy installation as per instructions. 5mins max. I've had it in place now for over 1week. Signals have improved and it now covers the rear garden area which has been a bonus. No more issues with my mobile phone signals. Great product for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to setup, good value Good instructiuons.
customer_reviews.text: It literally took me 5 minutes to set this up once I was using the correct method. I tried the WPS option which worked, I thought, but my phone wouldn't connect to it, it kept giving me a IP error. Once I reset the extender connected via a PC by following the instructions it was quick and easy. One thing to remember if you have a Virgin router, you have to reboot the Virgin router with the Extender connected otherwise the extender won't have internet authorisation.
customer_reviews.author: R. Mullen

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy - common issue
customer_reviews.text: It turns out this product continually drops the 2.4 wifi to the router. Looking on the Netgear support forums this has been an issue for years and has no solution. The 5G extension worked great, and I have ended up using the Faststeam mode of 5G to the router and then only 2.4 to any attached devices. I got this product as my main router is a Netgear, thinking it would work with it but it seems this extender is flawed.
customer_reviews.author: Pete

customer_reviews.title: If you have bad WiFi around the house you need this
customer_reviews.text: Needed this to extend our home virgin WiFi into the bedrooms Very easy to setup, connect it to your existing WiFi and and few other basic settings and it’s working The signal is quite strong and you get a choice of 2 or 5 hz Plugs straight into a standard power socket and has two useful lights on it for power and connection Had this over a year and so far no issues At all
customer_reviews.author: Al

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: I changed my internet supplier due to having bad internet (black spot in the house) and internet being slow. When I changed its seemed worse, kids constantly complaining internet lags. Spoke to my internet provider which was a waste of time as anything they did didn't help. I saw this on Amazon with really high reviews and thought might as well give it a go. The initial setup was a bit difficult if the WPS connection doesn't work but once up and running no one has complained. Kids said the internet is now great no Lagging. Great product, big thumbs up and would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Chowders

customer_reviews.title: Well priced, easy set up, good coverage
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my parents who’ve just got an iPad. They wanted to me able to use it in my fathers workshop and my mothers studio both of which are in the garden a little distance from the house. We plugged this in inside the conservatory in the plug closest to the outside wall and garden. Set up was simple with the included instructions. It’s easy to see when it’s working and happy to report it gives them coverage in both places and to the edge of their garden. Very pleased with this product. Bottom line- does what it says on the box. Good price and great coverage. I would purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Purple Paw

customer_reviews.title: Not plug and play
customer_reviews.text: Initial set up seemed ok, then it changed my router's name. Refused to accept the password, even though it said it would. Had to reset my BT router and start again. Set up went better 2nd time, and took me to a log in page for Netgear. set up login details and tried to add other devices, they ended up at the same login page, asking for same info, then refused the password, After two hours gave up and returned. Amazon returns v simple and easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Nigel

customer_reviews.title: Wanted so much for this to work..
customer_reviews.text: Set it up next to router, picked up signal, moved it to the lounge, NO SIGNAL! Tried again, same thing. Try again, but moved to a plug closure to router, yes ok, but it was in the hall just a few feet from the router. Went into the lounge, yes there was the signal, BUT, the signal from the router was stronger! Very disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: I.F.H

customer_reviews.title: Netgear are great quality items
customer_reviews.text: I have terrible internet access. If I want to watch Prime on tv, I have to disconnect anything else connected to my wifi. When my husband tried to watch it in bed, it would take an hour to watch a 30 minute program because it would be buffering so much. I bought this because I had one a few years ago but one of the antenna was broken and I'd never replaced it. Now the children have moved out I thought I'd get another to see if it would help. As long as I have everything else disconnected, it works well. Theres very little buffering. I've had a few items from Netgear and find their customer support, helpful.
customer_reviews.author: j.todd

customer_reviews.title: Works well but had to set up manually!
customer_reviews.text: Tried WPS connection, but it refused to connect to 5G network even though the bandwidth was split and it was right next to the router. However, went into the manual connection with my tablet and was able to configure the setup, even renaming the extender to differentiate from another Netgear extender (5 years old!) in a different part of my (large) house. Now nice stable connection. Have used Netgear for many years and always found them reliable and privided this gives the same reliability, will continue to do so.
customer_reviews.author: Jonners

customer_reviews.title: Wasn’t good for my use case.
customer_reviews.text: This didn’t solve the problem I purchased it for. For it to work best you need to place it within strong WiFi range of the existing router. For me I don’t have issues in that area. If you place it in the edge it becomes unreliable and drops a lot of packets. The other thing I didn’t consider is it needs to run on a separate SSID therefore you can’t seamlessly walk around your property, you’ll need to keep changing between the booster and the primary router SSID which personally I think defects the point of this. For this to work I’d need to purchase a WiFi Mesh network which are expensive in comparison
customer_reviews.author: Mr Sunny K

customer_reviews.title: Useful little piece of kit
customer_reviews.text: Very useful. Did extend the wifi to the back of my garden from my router at the front of my house. Very easy to install and set up. However, it does not boost the signal. It only extends the signal at whatever the wifi strength is at the point you position it. I.e. if it's a weak signal at the installation point, then it will only extend the signal at that strength.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Simply works!!!!
customer_reviews.text: struggled with (virgin) wifi in the conservatory so decided to give this a try. Didn't link at first but followed the simple instructions of logging on to the website and then plugged placed it in the conservatory, imeadiate affect wifi now perfect wifi in conservatory, garden and down at the furthest point in the garden some 50ft away it is working but at its limit so sometimes drops out. Best £20 spent may consider looking for if a stronger extender would be better but for the moment this little extender is brilliant.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Stott

customer_reviews.title: It's pretty slow off fast wifi
customer_reviews.text: We have very fast wifi and the signal where the booster is, is also decent. But the wifi we get using the booster is very slow, much slower than the main wifi. Could not use for a work laptop or much streaming. It also drops a lot. We use it for wifi cameras and I would say 50% of the time it won't stream because it is so slow and unstable.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley S.

customer_reviews.title: Works well but delicate
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to extend wifi coverage in the house to an area that seemed not to get reached. This plugin was really easy to set up and connect to - and it did seem to do what it should. Functionally, it's absolutely fine. It's just that it sticks out quite a bit from the wall socket - and that makes it vulnerable. At the time of writing this review, it has already suffered at the hands of the vacuum cleaner and one of the antennae was broken off. I would recommend installing it somewhere out of the way, but that seems to go against what it is designed for.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Very small, Very powerful
customer_reviews.text: Live in a Welsh farmhouse so lots of space and 5 bedrooms over 2 buildings but walls are 9 inch thick stone. Tried all ways to get a signal in all rooms but it was only when I discovered this little gizmo that everything became clear. Found a corridor between buildings and about half way from router. Hit the WPS button and it worked first time. Wi-fi printer came to life and ipad picked up the network in the furthest room. Very happy and would recommend this easy to install extender to anyone
customer_reviews.author: Khadian

customer_reviews.title: Very Little Improvement In Signal
customer_reviews.text: This looked ideal for my office which is based in my garage conversion which is about 6 feet away from the main house. I was very disappointed as there is little improvement in signal. When it does work it is very unreliable & you frequently lose the signal so it is pretty useless as I need a constant wifi signal in my office. I end up having to rely on the original weak signal from the house. I have tried positioning it inside the main house half way as per the recommendation & I have tried positioning it by the window inside the garage conversion. neither of these result in a strong reliable signal.
customer_reviews.author: Andy Oliver

customer_reviews.title: Waste of time
customer_reviews.text: We have a 3 storey town house. Our router is on the ground floor. I placed extender on the middle floor. All the lights displayed to show a full connection to router. My laptop gets better download speeds from the main router than the extender. I've tested the extender with my laptop in an adjacent room to the extender and on the top floor. I work in IT so I know what I'm doing. Like Netgear equipment, had high hopes but hasn't made any difference for me.
customer_reviews.author: G Suttie

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed- do not buy
customer_reviews.text: Bought the Netgear range extender 8 months ago, and now it has suddenly stopped working. It was working fine in the morning, and now suddenly it has suddenly stopped working, despite doing a factory reset and trying to reconnect. It connects to the router but does not give any internet signal. When I tried to check if I can return it (within 1 yr), it doesn’t give me this option. Very very disappointing and would not recommend as even to get to any tech support you need to buy a plan to get anywhere.
customer_reviews.author: Happy

customer_reviews.title: Frustrating, expected much better.
customer_reviews.text: Over three hours wasted trying to set this up. I work in IT and have used and set these blighters up in the past. I tried every possible method suggested by Netgear and other reviewers on here, with no joy whatsoever. I honestly cannot type out everything I tried, as I'll just get angry again. It should be so straightforward, an extender made by Netgear, connecting to a router made by Netgear, in a house where another extender made by Netgear works and has worked perfectly for some time. I've since bought a TP-Link AC1200, setup and working within 10 minutes. NETGEAR EX6120-100UKS Performance Wi-Fi Range Extender AC1200 - AVOID Being returned ASAP
customer_reviews.author: Neil M

customer_reviews.title: Oh dear
customer_reviews.text: I bought several of these as I live in an old stone house and Wi-Fi range is very reduced. I really thought these would be plug and play, but oh no. Even in this day and age we have to fanny around, log into routers etc...what a blinking pain. These units lose their passwords, you get a power cut, have to reset the WPS etc.etc.etc...WHY Netgear..shouldn't be necessary. You have to do factory resets, WHY is it so hard nowadays to plug a extender in and connect... Netgear is NOT user-friendly at all. Compared to proper technology, this is junk...
customer_reviews.author: Paul J.

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't support correct wi-fi country codes
customer_reviews.text: All AP's should match the same country code, for UK that's 'GB'. most AP's and whatnot allow you to set it as it's part of the standard. If you're moving from one to another and the code changes then you can drop the connection. On these the only option is 'Europe' meaning that on my one anyway the code is transmitting as France 'Fr'. Some kit ignores the standard so isn't a problem but Apple kit will moan about it. I checked with Netgear's tech support and they didn't have a fix or recommendation. So this created more problems than it solved on my network. Stick to TP-Link kit as that has the correct options.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Matthew Stringer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Install, Works Like a Charm
customer_reviews.text: We are with TalkTalk and the Wifi from the hub is terrible.Our hub is at the bottom of the stairs in our small house, the bedroom at the top and the wifi constantly cuts out. I looked on TalkTalk and they suggested an extender, theirs coosting £30 with delivery charges. Came on here, picked this one and it has made the world of difference. No cutting out, easy to set up. Very happy so far. It's only been a few days but I can highly recommend. We use it for phones, Nintendo Switch and Kindle.
customer_reviews.author: lynette

customer_reviews.title: Massive hype, underwhelming performance.
customer_reviews.text: I was persuaded to buy this by the hype in the listing. Yes, it’s easy to install, but it made little or no difference to my wifi coverage. I’ve tested speeds and coverage with and without the unit on, and there’s no discernible difference. Massive hype, underwhelming performance. Very disappointing, especially at the price.
customer_reviews.author: james

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: It works well with the SuperHub 3, but You MUST go into the SuperHub3 settings, 'Advanced Settings', into wireless, then into 'WPS' and then press 'Add Client' - Press that; then press the WPS button on the wifi extender and it should connect without any issues. Without doing this, it will not connect! see less.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant, well worth the money .
customer_reviews.text: I have a 4 bed real old house that’s got metal girders throughout, I can’t get signal on any device that’s outside the room that the WiFi box is in, I’ve tried all sorts of extenders and they’ve never worked, I bought this one and omg it’s brilliant, I bought one for upstairs and one for downstairs and there was no need , one went through the hole house, full signal on everything and much faster which I didn’t no it made the WiFi faster when I bought it, quick to set up and don’t forget to join the extender network which will come up as your normal WiFi name but with ‘exe’ one the end of it .
customer_reviews.author: rebekah

customer_reviews.title: Good product, does what it claims
customer_reviews.text: A good device, I use it in the kitchen to provide signal to an outside patio. OK to set up. The one criticism is that - unlike Devolo mains wiring systems, it has a different SSID from its 'parent' wifi router so devices (phones, tablets etc.) have to have their network connection changed as they move round the house.
customer_reviews.author: M. M. Otway

customer_reviews.title: A Great Product
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as i couldn't use my Ipad in my bedroom. As it has been said and covered in many reviews, it is so easy to set up and use. I plugged it in the same room as the router and switched it on. Then pressed the WPS on the extender, pressed the WPS on the router until it starts to flash. Within a couple of minutes the lights were steady green. I then plugged it in to a spare socket on the landing and waited for green lights. Success. I went on my iPad's wifi, found the network .....EXT, entered my password and voila, a good wifi signal around the house. It's early days, but fingers crossed.
customer_reviews.author: pagsy

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: This WiFi extender was a complete waste of money, not only did it take along time to set up it says download speeds up too 300mbps my broadband does up to 220mbps but the max download speeds where between 10 and 40mbps I even had it plugged in next to the router and did a speed test and it was still not giving me good download speeds, don't waste your money on this.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Worked great for about 24 hours, then died
customer_reviews.text: Took a bit of figuring out how to get the login/registration page to load when not using WPS, but eventually got there (you need to be connected to the extended network before the web page will open). Updated the firmware and all was working fine. moved the device to its new location, plugged it in and all was well. Next morning i had a solid amber light, which according to the forums means its 'rebooting'. problem is that it never finishes rebooting. Factory reset doesn't fix the problem, which means the firmware upgrade probably corrupted the firmware. 20 min on Amazon support (they are always helpful) and they are sending me a new device. hopefully this one works longer!
customer_reviews.author: M. Lyseyko

customer_reviews.title: Device burnt and tripped the fuse of entire house
customer_reviews.text: I had this device for less than 9 months and today it suddenly burnt. There was a loud noise and I was frantically checking the entire house where the noise came from. Soon I found out that the internet was down and none of the sockets were working. Checked the fuse box and found that one of the fuses were tripped. To be honest, I was never happy with this device. For first 2-3 months, it connected without any issues. Soon the quality of signals kept degrading. I tried to reset it twice and it was of no use. Gladly, Amazon provided a refund on this device.
customer_reviews.author: P Upadhyay

customer_reviews.title: Good inexpensive solution to dodgy wifi
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to extend the wifi into a far corner of the house. It works fine. Setup was slightly fiddly as my router doesn't do WPS, but I had it all going in a few minutes. These simple extenders require you to use a different SSID for the extended network, so it's not as seamless as the cleverer mesh networking solutions out there, but those are at least 3 times the price. At this price point, this little Netgear box is a good solution - but yes it will cut down your wifi speed a bit. If you care about that, go mesh.
customer_reviews.author: Limiting Factor

customer_reviews.title: Simple, effective range extender
customer_reviews.text: Very straight forward to attach to an existing WIFI network. Don't need to have a Netgear WIFI router - compatible with others. We get 50m+ range through brick walls now. One point (which affects other extenders): finding the best location for the extender can be trial and error. Too close to the router and you don't gain any range, too far and the network speed falls and/or connections drop.
customer_reviews.author: JHP Stuart

customer_reviews.title: Terrrrrriblllee!!!
customer_reviews.text: I know people said this could be tricky, you are not joking!. After trying for an hour it would not connect. If you dont have an ethernet wire your in trouble. Ive tried the wps thing multiple times and no cigar! The help page is not helpful and neither are the youtube videos they put up. Kerp saying find tjr device on your wifi whic basically it doesnt. So its a big pile of crap and its getting returned. Home you have better luck than i did
customer_reviews.author: Jenny Irish

customer_reviews.title: This Is Rubbish In My Experience!!
customer_reviews.text: The EX2700 is the model we bought with high expectations. Sadly however, we find that it is very poor, its download speed is simply hopeless for our use. We find trying to get any app to actually perform properly painfully slow due to the slow performance despite the claims made by NETGEAR!!
customer_reviews.author: bubobubo

customer_reviews.title: Ok for the price
customer_reviews.text: These are not boosters, companies should not be able to get away with calling them that. These just extended the wifi signal. If you use this somewhere where you have an average signal it's not going to improve the quality of it all it will do is help extend the same signal into another room where you can't get a signal from your router because there's a wall or some other object degrading the signal. All this does essentially is bounce the signal to get it round an obstruction. The extender works well and is easy to use, I've not had any issues with it.
customer_reviews.author: L. Snowden

customer_reviews.title: Easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: I had to set this up using the laptop but the instructions were easy to follow and it worked fine. My router comes in through the front of the house and I wanted to use it for my bt box at the back of the house. Once set up I connected my box to it and it works a treat. Sometimes a message comes on the screen to say the broadband signal can't be detected but it is always quickly followed by another to say it has been restored. This doesn't seem to break or pause the signal so I ignore it and carry on watching. Good product and value for money.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This has transformed my wifi
customer_reviews.text: I have a three story house with Virgin Media broadband in Ireland, the router is in the corner of my sitting room downstairs and hidden behind the tv so my 1 yr old daughter can't play with it. This has let to my wifi signal being terrible in some rooms in the house, particularly my office which is upstairs. This wifi extender has gotten rid of all the dead spots and now I have wifi in the garden too which is great for listening to spotify on sunny days without using up my 5gb data allowance on my work phone.
customer_reviews.author: Dhoban

customer_reviews.title: Totally Frustating Waste of Time
customer_reviews.text: Although it clearly boosted the signal I could not get it to work despite following the instructions Contacting their help organisation was convoluted frustrating and time consuming. When I did get through I was continually asked to go through the same remedial steps I had tried again and again. I spent more time than the equipment was worth on the phone. Afterwards it worked on one device while their employee was on the phone and immediately stopped afterwards. An incredible and stressful waste of time. Sent item back
customer_reviews.author: Jack Swainston.

customer_reviews.title: Does what it says on the tin
customer_reviews.text: Bought this one as my older BT one randomly broke one evening. It’s a great piece of kit, very easy to set up and is compact compared to some of the other ones on the market. I use this to connect my PS4 to the internet via ethernet (for a better connection) and it’s been great so far. I don’t know/haven’t worked out whether you can have this set up as a 2.4GHZ or 5GHZ so I need to do some more fiddling around with it. Overall it’s a great product and worth the money, would highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Dean Edward Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I had a problem with my Wi-Fi connection in an upstairs room , could barely get a signal , I purchased this product and so glad I did , I now have a full signal. its so simple to set up and just does the job perfectly. Just follow the instructions supplied , make sure you connect the extender to the router in the same room as the router . looking at some reviews this seems to be where most people make a mistake . If you follow that part of the instruction the rest is strait forward . Great product.
customer_reviews.author: pictaker

customer_reviews.title: Couldn't log into it with any device
customer_reviews.text: Managed to connect it to my network, no problem, could not get any device to connect to it, continual "Incorrect Password". Instructions are useless - as you would expect - unless everything goes smoothly. Tech support very difficult to track down. When I finally found the number, was greeted with "We are extremely busy at the moment". Decided that I had already spent too much time, so gave up and went through Amazon return process.
customer_reviews.author: fatbloke

customer_reviews.title: Netgear to the rescue
customer_reviews.text: Arrived fast as always. Setup could not be easier - as others have said just use the WPS button on your router to connect and you are away. Recently moved into a new property with the only phone line being in a boot room by the front door, meaning WiFi signal in the rest of the house was non existent . Having lost my previous WiFi booster during the move this purchase was priority while waiting for the line to be moved. Line has now been moved and this still remains plugged in as it works so well across the house. Good speed - easy setup
customer_reviews.author: Paul-Peter De La Cruz

customer_reviews.title: Why can't these Products be clear about distance they can cover?
customer_reviews.text: It frustrates me hwy you cant get a simple understanding of the ranges and limitations of these products. It stated on the product overview that it could cover a set range. I wanted it to cover 30 meters which was well within that range. I needed it to support an EV Wallbox in a car parking space. To cut a long story short, it was actually a worse coverage that what was there before. I went with a TELTONIKA 4G /LTE & WiFi cellular router with Ethernet and I/O in the end, which solved my problem
customer_reviews.author: MJS

customer_reviews.title: Dont waste your time.
customer_reviews.text: Following all instructions and trying to enter my password in to connect devices, to no avail ,no connection, even though I had all the relevant green lights on . I would like to think I'm tech savvy ,but this little extension isnt for me. For those whove enjoyed this product good for you but I've spent the last 2 days being bounced from pillar to post to get this product to work. I know they're better products out there and I'm going to use one of them. I've lost 22.2 hrs via tech support, web pages and troubleshooting ,enough is enough.
customer_reviews.author: Hugh murphy

customer_reviews.title: EX3700 - Great signal, no internet connection
customer_reviews.text: An "Easy to install" wifi extender from a trusted company... or so I thought. Set up was OK it was quick but some of the English in the instructions was not so good (which was odd from Netgear). Tested the signal strength and that was very good. However, every device that connected to the extended wifi reported no internet connection. Seemed fairly common problem from the forum chatter, lots of fixes suggested. I may be tech savy but I don't have the time to mess about so I sent it back. It spent less than 24 hrs with me. I will buy from something another maker.
customer_reviews.author: Steve172360

customer_reviews.title: Very poor speeds.
customer_reviews.text: Set up was no problem, used WPS to connect to my BT Smarthub 6. I have a fast fibre connection with down and up speeds of about 64Mb/s and 19Mb/s respectively. Connecting to the extender with the same laptop and using the same speed tester results in 3.41Mb/s down and 7.94 Mb/s up. That is terrible, unusable and unacceptable. What an awful product! Edited to add that the speeds have dropped even more to 345Kb/s down and 486kB/s up. Returned for refund. Not fit for purpose.
customer_reviews.author: Ford Prefect

customer_reviews.title: Definite Improvement
customer_reviews.text: Great, definitely boosts the signal. For the price (£14.99 on offer) it's a bargain. We were struggling on our PlusNet router with WiFi and I didn't want to fork out for a mega expensive gaming router, as they suggested, to boost the signal so went with this little baby instead. Only thing is, every time I switch on my devices, even out of 'sleep', I have to reconnect to the extension, which is irritating, hence the 4 stars, not 5. Sometimes even the phones have to be reconnected after being away from the connection at home. But a small price to pay for fast broadband all over the house again.
customer_reviews.author: NJT

customer_reviews.title: can't rely on it
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install and frequently updated with new firmware releases. However, even if you know what you are doing network wise, the thing is just not reliable, every few days or so it needs to be restarted (luckily it can be done through it's web interface) else it simply stops sending packets. Also, don't think it will solve your range issues, it does extend the signal but only by a few metres (if there is a wall in between). I found it works best by enabling fastlane technology.
customer_reviews.author: Pro

customer_reviews.title: Appears to 'do the job', but not convinced
customer_reviews.text: Simple installation, relatively simple to set up, but can't really establish the difference between this and other models (that look similar, but with different features) from this manufacturer. Once connected the unit appears to switch in and out of connection with indicator lights on the front of the unit changing from green to amber to red and then back again for no apparent reason. In a small cottage where you would question whether you actually need such a device to extend the WiFi range anyway, it's hard to understand if it's helping at all...personally I'm not convinced that it's £40 well spent and no proof or evidence that it actually works!!
customer_reviews.author: Michaeljon

customer_reviews.title: When it works it works well
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to link up with our Virgin WIFI box and the range extension is very good and works extremely well. We have an extension and there's a lot of metal stud work in the walls so one room has always been signal free but this placed on the landing outside the door gives a good signal. The only problem with it is you have to keep re-pairing with the wifi router. I think this must be something to do with the router reissuing IP addresses or perhaps being restarted by our provider (Virgin). The longest stint we've had is about 7 days
customer_reviews.author: Mr. R. Williams

customer_reviews.title: An inexpensive, easy to set up, WiFi extender
customer_reviews.text: I needed a WiFi extender as I am installing a WiFi based security system and need the main unit to be hard wired to the router but to avoid cables everywhere, I thought an extender would be just fine as it could be placed near the main security unit. I could not get access to the router to press the button on it to connect to the extender so used the Netgear Genie. Very easy to sort out and quickly connected. The customer service centre of the CCTV manufacturers said it was a very good idea too; they had not thought of that!
customer_reviews.author: Goaty

customer_reviews.title: A good electronics anarak needed to fit this bit of kit!
customer_reviews.text: This range expander does what it should, but the instructions are difficult to follow. I had to get my son. who knows about these things, to sort out the bewildering instructions, and then he had to google to finally get it to perform. I would say that if you intend to buy this, then be prepared to struggle if you are not too savvy with electronic stuff. As it is I have lost my Alexa Dot due to me forgetting the Virgin Hub password, so I'm waiting for my son to regain his temper so he can reinstall the Alexa software. Be warned this item is not for the faint-hearted!
customer_reviews.author: Charly T

customer_reviews.title: Improved our signal no end.
customer_reviews.text: This has brought internet harmony to our 3 user household. For ages we’ve found our signal frustratingly unreliable so I thought I’d give this product a try. Setup is really easy if you use the WPS button on the device and your Wifi router. Make sure you do the initial setup really close to your router, after this you can reposition it. I did experiment with different locations- you’ll know it’s right when you get two green lights at the top (see photo). If you get red or amber lights just try a different location.
customer_reviews.author: P. A. Douglas

customer_reviews.title: Could not get it to work with my Virgin Wifi
customer_reviews.text: I was really pleased that I could boost my Wifi as I cannot get it all the time in some rooms. However, I could not get this to work, it would not pair, also I found that it was a lot more difficult to even try than it should have been, having to go onto the laptop and everything. It was therefore was totally useless and I had to return it. No problems returning it though so at least that was a plus
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. Jane Fry

customer_reviews.title: Great bit of kit, sky router doesn't have wap button
customer_reviews.text: After an initial problem, finding out sky router doesn't have a wap button, had to set up using the website, I initially tried this using my phone, but it would not automatically connect to the web page, and I was going to give up, but luckily I decided to use a laptop and it was a very simple process after that, just give it time to do its stuff, when you think you've waited long enough, just wait that little bit longer, I'm talking seconds not minutes, so far brilliant connection and I now have a happy daughter who's wifi doesn't keep dropping out.
customer_reviews.author: GRAEME D CROCKATT

customer_reviews.title: does the job
customer_reviews.text: This works really well, i used my phone to set it up, then connected my doorbell and security cameras to it, as they were having trouble being so far away from my router. If your wifi will not reach to where you need it, this will sort out your issue.. im sure. once you link it to your internet, you can move it to the edge of your wifi range, and this will pick up the wifi and boost it. I have used this to lend a neighbour internet and it gave him full signal . definitely worth it if you need a wifi booster
customer_reviews.author: Gillius

customer_reviews.title: Easy set up but packed in working after a month!
customer_reviews.text: OK, I was apprehensive about this based on other reviews highlighting set up problems. I used the WPS method and everything was set up and connected within minutes. That's the good stuff out of the way! It worked perfectly for a month or so and then just stopped. Everything appears to be connected, green light indicating the connection to the router is fine, green light when a device connects but no Internet connection at all. Tried the suggested factory resets, reinstalling, giving static IP addresses to devices but nothing worked. I've had to replace it with another model from a different manufacturer. It's put me off the netgear brand. These should be plug and play and reliable. This is not!
customer_reviews.author: R P Brown

product_meta.title: NETGEAR N300 WiFi Range Extender
product_meta.description: Say goodbye to Wi-Fi dead zones. Convenient, discreet and easy to install, extended Wi-Fi coverage is just an outlet away with this essentials edition extender. Boost your Wi-Fi for mobile devices and connect a wired device such as Smart TVs or game consoles.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.1 out of 5 stars11,210 ratings4.1 out of 5 stars
